translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions for Phenomena

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  atīta ttika dvaya
translated: The Triad Sets of the Conditions

original: Naatīto dhammo paccuppannassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naanāgato dhammo paccuppannassa🔽dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Naatīto ca naanāgato ca dhammā paccuppannassa dhammassa🔽hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na atītaḥ dhammo paccuppannassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na anāgataḥ dhammo paccuppannassa  dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na atīto ca na anāgato ca dhammā paccuppannassa dhammassa  hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A past phenomenon is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a present phenomenon. A future phenomenon is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a present phenomenon. A past and a future phenomenon is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a present phenomenon. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe adhipatiyā satta, anantare tīṇi …pe… nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye satta, purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe adhipatiyā satta anantare tīṇi pe nissaye tīṇi upanissaye satta purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: In the case of root-cause condition, there are three; in the case of object condition, of predominance condition, there are seven; in the case of proximity condition, there are three; … in the case of support condition, there are three; in the case of decisive support condition, there are seven; in the case of prenascence condition, of postnascence condition, there are three; … in the case of absence condition, there are three.

original: Naatītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca atītārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naatītārammaṇaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca anāgatārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naatītārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: na atīta ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca atīta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na atīta ārammaṇa  dhammam paṭicca anāgata ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na atīta ārammaṇam dhamma
translated: A past object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a past phenomenon. A past object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a future phenomenon. A past object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a present phenomenon. … There are three.

original: paṭicca paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: paṭicca paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A future object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a past phenomenon. A future object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a future phenomenon. A future object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a present phenomenon. … There are three.🔽A present object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a past phenomenon. A present object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a future phenomenon. A present object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a present phenomenon. … There are three.

original: Naanāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca atītārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naanāgatārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.🔽Napaccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca paccuppannārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Napaccuppannārammaṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca atītārammaṇo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca atīta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na anāgata ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dve  na paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  na paccuppanna ārammaṇam dhammam paṭicca atīta ārammaṇaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
